sub section 1.1: TSMC's revenue for Q1 2022 was approximately USD 17.9 billion, reflecting a year-over-year increase of 25% compared to Q1 2021. This growth was driven by strong demand in the automotive and high-performance computing sectors. The revenue in Q1 2022 compared to Q4 2021 represented a 12.1% increase. The reasons for this revenue increase include a robust demand surge particularly in high-performance computing and automotive sectors. The revenue results for Q1 2022 aligned closely with the guidance provided in Q4 2021, which anticipated a range of about USD 17.6 billion to USD 18.2 billion.

sub section 1.2: The total wafer sales for Q1 2022 are characterized by a significant contribution from advanced technologies, specifically those at 7-nanometer and below, which accounted for approximately 50% of wafer revenue. While specific figures related to wafer quantity and average selling price (ASP) were not disclosed, the strong demand in the high-performance computing and automotive sectors positively influenced sales performance.

sub section 2.1: In Q1 2022, TSMC's sales figures by segment were approximately as follows: Smartphones accounted for 40% of revenue, High-Performance Computing (HPC) comprised 41%, Internet of Things (IoT) contributed 8%, Automotive represented 5%, and Data Center Equipment (DCE) made up 3%. The margins for each segment were expected to range between 56% and 58% gross margin and 45% to 47% operating margin. Management communicated confidence in maintaining market share and profitability despite potential challenges.

sub section 2.2: For Q2 2022, TSMC expects revenue to fall between USD 17.6 billion and USD 18.2 billion, reflecting a sequential increase. Management anticipates continued demand in high-performance computing and automotive sectors, supporting the overall positive guidance for the coming quarter amid ongoing macroeconomic challenges.
